basics.name: John Yamamoto
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.A. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2027.

work.summary: Worked for the company's helpdesk, worked on small hardware projects for the company, and studied computer networking.
highlights: Provide consistently quick and amiable service to clients on the helpdesk
Diligently work with IT team to complete large-scale e-waste project for the company
Gain a lot of practice configuring cisco switches.

volunteer.summary: Volunteer to serve homeless youth and homeless people on the streets.
highlights: Lead a team of friends to serve pizza and cold sodas to homeless people in Oahu's downtown area.
Serve meals and spend time with homeless youth at RYSE.
Served on a team that provides food, showers, and clothing to Waikiki's homeless population.

volunteer.organization: Hawaii Baptist Academy National Honor Society
volunteer.position: St. Francis/Food Delivery Committee Co-Chair and Hope for the Homeless Committee Member
volunteer.summary: Led the St. Francis and Food Delivery Committees to serve St. Francis hospital, serve at a food shelter,
highlights: Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
